comments:
EMF Models (Create a new generator model resource) wizard is broken when 
genmodels are specified that do not have namespaces NsURI.

Invoke the wizard using New > Other > EMF Models

The bug is in EMFProjectWizard.java:

                     {
                       if (genPackage.getEcorePackage().getNsURI
().equalsIgnoreCase(ePackage.getNsURI()))
                       {
                         checkedGenPackages.add(genPackage);
                         break;
                       }

You can repro using the following 3 models.  Create genmodels for the first 
two (query.ecore and noNs.ecore).
Then create a genmodel for the 3rd (useNoNs.ecore). The code above will be 
tripped to generate a null pointer exception.
When creating the genmodels use the "Load from am EMF core model" option and 
on the second and third use the "Referenced Generator models:"

query.ecore:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<ecore:EPackage xmi:version="2.0"
    xmlns:xmi="http://www.omg.org/XMI" 
xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
    xmlns:ecore="http://www.eclipse.org/emf/2002/Ecore" name="query"
    nsURI="http:///z/query/query.ecore" nsPrefix="z.query">
  <eClassifiers xsi:type="ecore:EClass" name="Query" interface="true"/>
</ecore:EPackage>

noNs.ecore:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<ecore:EPackage xmi:version="2.0"
    xmlns:xmi="http://www.omg.org/XMI" 
xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
    xmlns:ecore="http://www.eclipse.org/emf/2002/Ecore" name="noNs">
  <eClassifiers xsi:type="ecore:EClass" name="ProviderLocation" 
interface="true">
    <eStructuralFeatures xsi:type="ecore:EReference" name="query" 
eType="ecore:EClass query.ecore#//Query"/>
  </eClassifiers>
</ecore:EPackage>

useNoNs.ecore:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<ecore:EPackage xmi:version="2.0"
    xmlns:xmi="http://www.omg.org/XMI" 
xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
    xmlns:ecore="http://www.eclipse.org/emf/2002/Ecore" name="useNoNs">
  <eClassifiers xsi:type="ecore:EClass" name="UseNoNs" interface="true">
    <eStructuralFeatures xsi:type="ecore:EReference" name="p" 
eType="ecore:EClass noNs.ecore#//ProviderLocation"/>
  </eClassifiers>
</ecore:EPackage>

java.lang.NullPointerException

at java.lang.Throwable.<init>(Throwable.java)

A non-null nsURI is a requirement for all EPackages. Since we'd like to handle
this more gracefully, I'll mark it as a duplicate of bug 75933, which covers the
complete problem of validating Ecore models.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 75933 ***
